testInfo.description: Comprehensive assessment covering quantitative aptitude, English proficiency, and data structures & algorithms concepts

questions.question: If Feb 12th, 1986 falls on Wednesday then Jan 1st, 1987 falls on which day?

Rahul borrowed a sum of Rs.2250 from Amit at the simple interest rate of 6 p.c.p.a. for 3 years. He then added some more money to the borrowed sum and lent it to Sachin for the same time at 9 p.c.p.a. simple interest. If Rahul gains Rs.274.95 by way of interest on borrowed sum as well as his own amount from the whole transaction, then what is the sum lent by him to Sachin?
Find the cost price of an article on rate 5% per annum with two equal instalment of 8820rs of each on compounded annually?

What is the percentage increase in the price of a product from last year to this year? Statement 1: The price of the product last year was $50, and this year it is $60. Statement 2: The price of the product this year is $60.
options: Statement 1 alone is sufficient, but Statement 2 alone is not sufficient
Statement 2 alone is sufficient, but Statement 1 alone is not sufficient
Both statements together are sufficient, but neither statement alone is sufficient

questions.question: If log X/(a² + ab + b²) = log Y/(b² + bc + c²) = log Z/(c² + ca + a²), then X^(a-b) × Y^(b-c) × Z^(c-a) = ?

It takes eleven hours for a 600 km journey, if 120 km is done by train and the rest by car. It takes 40 minutes more, if 200 km is done by train and the rest by car. What is the ratio of the speed of the train to that of the car?
A and B together can do a piece of work in 30 days. B and C together can do the same work in 45 days & C and A together complete it in 60 days. In how many days C alone could complete it?
If a pipe A can fill a tank 3 times faster than pipe B and takes 32 minutes less than pipe B to fill the tank. If both the pipes are opened simultaneously, then find the time taken to fill the tank?

A boat travels from point A to B, a distance of 12 km. From A it travels 4 km downstream in 15 minutes and the remaining 8 km upstream to reach B. If the downstream speed is four times as high as the upstream speed, what is the average speed of the boat for the journey from A to B?
A man rows 'k' km upstream and back again downstream to the same point in H hours. The speed of rowing in still water is s km/hr and the rate of stream is r km/hr. Then:
Find the number of zeros in 532!
The product of two numbers is 2028 and their H.C.F is 13. The number of such pairs is?
N is the greatest number that will divide 734, 761 and 1463 leaving the same remainder in each case. What is sum of digits of N?

Madhuri starts at Point T, walks straight to point U which is 4 ft. away. She turns left, at 90° and walks to W which is 4 ft. away, turns 90° right and goes 3 ft. to P, turns 90° right and walks 4 ft. to Q, turns left at 90° and goes to V, which is 1 ft. away and once again turns 90° right and goes to O, 6 ft. away. What is the distance between T and O?

A and B contest in an election, if the ratio between the valid votes and the vote got by A is 5:3 and the ratio of invalid votes and vote got by B is 1:2 and the ratio between the valid and invalid votes is 5:1 then find the ratio between the votes got by A and B.

Identify the parts which are correct in terms of grammar, spelling and logical consistency: A. The worse attack on this peacekeeping B. mission is a tragic reminder C. of how this conflict is D. spiralling out of control.

I. Yellowstone National Park is the oldest national park in the US and likely the world. II. Anyone can drive through the park and encounter an array of wildlife a few feet away. Select the correct option:
options: If there is an error only in the first sentence
If there is an error only in the second sentence
If there are errors in both sentences
If there is no error in either of the sentences

questions.question: The Brazilian market for (A)/ flying is expected to grow (B)/ by around 10% per year (C)/ annually for at least (D)/ the next three or four years (E). Choose parts with no error:
Since the grid now has more (A)/ than one owner, it is often (B)/ hard to know whom will (C)/ bear the risks and who (D)/ will be garnering the rewards (E). Choose parts with no error:
Select the sentence which is error-free:
options: Ms. Mangeshkar is not first victim from filmdom of the bogus news syndrome
Ms. Mangeshkar is not the first victim from filmdom of the bogus newses syndrome
Ms. Mangeshkar is not the first victims from filmdom of the bogus news syndrome
Ms. Mangeshkar is not the first victim from filmdom of the bogus news syndrome

questions.question: In today's world, privacy (1) and a company's ability (2) to secure personal data has become an practice (3) component of strong business essential (4). Which words need to be swapped?

In this new age of discussions (1) governance, issues like gender equality (2), equal pay, diversity, and environmental responsibility (3) are becoming second nature in daily business corporate (4). Which words need to be swapped?

Physical exercise can help counter (1) the loss of memory delay (2) by Alzheimer's as well as caused (3) the onset of the most common type of dementia, according (4) to a study. Which words need to be swapped?

Sudden, unpredictable drops in associated (1) income during young adulthood are personal (2) with an increased risk of developing heart (3) disease and/or dying (4) from any cause. Which words need to be swapped?
One of the most significant phenomenons of our time has been the development of cinema. Replace 'phenomenons' with:
For many centuries in Indian History there was no city so famous like the city of Ujjain. Replace 'like' with:
Acquisition of certain specific skills can be facilitated from general awareness, education to novel situations. Replace 'facilitated from' with:
Why did you not threw the bag away? Correct the error:
The intruder stood quietly for few moments. Correct the error:
Choose the grammatically correct sentence:
options: Neither he nor his friends was present
Either you or I am responsible
The team are winning the match
Each of the students have completed

questions.question: What is the worst-case time complexity of QuickSort when all elements are equal?
Which of the following data structures is NOT stable when used in its standard form?
The maximum number of nodes in a binary tree of height h is:
Which data structure gives the best average search performance when data is static and searched frequently?
What is the time complexity of inserting an element in a max-heap of size n?
In a Red-Black Tree, which of the following properties is TRUE?
options: Every red node has a red parent
Root can be red or black
All paths from root to leaves contain the same number of red nodes

questions.question: The recurrence T(n) = 2T(n/2) + n/log n has complexity:
Which traversal method is used to obtain the prefix expression from an expression tree?
In a graph with V vertices and E edges, the time complexity of Dijkstra's algorithm (using a binary heap) is:
What is the amortized time complexity of a single push operation in a dynamically growing stack (array doubling technique)?
Which of the following statements is TRUE about a Trie (Prefix Tree)?
options: It is used only for numerical data
Memory usage is always less than BST

questions.question: Which data structure is most efficient for implementing Least Recently Used (LRU) Cache?
In Kruskal's algorithm, which data structure is used to detect cycles efficiently?
The time complexity of searching in a balanced Binary Search Tree (BST) is:
What is the auxiliary space complexity of Merge Sort?
Which of the following algorithms can be used to detect negative-weight cycles in a graph?
A circular queue is full when:
What is the best case time complexity of Bubble Sort?
If a hash table uses chaining and the number of keys inserted is n, with m slots, the expected time for an unsuccessful search is:
Which of the following is the most space-efficient representation for a sparse graph?
